name: Pao Huei Renshen
title: Pao Huei Renshen
overview:
Pao Huei Renshen is a luxury residential development in Taichung, Taiwanâ€™s second-largest city with over 2.85 million residents. Located near Shakeng Park, the scheme features two elegant towers set within a lushly landscaped site. Tower A, in the southeast quadrant, rises 37 storeys, while Tower B in the northwest reaches 49 storeys. Both towers are connected at ground and second floor via glazed corridors and share a seven-level basement.

The design emphasizes tall, slender forms that emerge from a planted ground plane. Each tower features an H-shaped floorplate, maximizing natural light and cross-ventilation while enabling the creation of elevated sky gardens at every third floor. These gardens reinforce the relationship between the architecture and the surrounding landscape.

Living areas and master bedrooms are positioned to capture long views to the north and south, with secondary rooms facing east and west. Green balconies at regular intervals establish a horizontal rhythm across the towers, contrasting with their vertical emphasis. Curved corners on balconies and modular bays define both the structural logic and the appearance of the buildings.

At ground level and Level 2, the towers are surrounded by a series of interconnected gardens, terraces, pavilions, and canopies that weave through the site. Residents and visitors arrive via a tree-lined avenue in the southwest quadrant, entering through a luminous, stone-clad reception pavilion. From here, they are directed to either tower through the shared lobby.

Conceptually, each tower aligns with a linear garden -Tower A to the northeast and Tower B to the southwest, where the visitor drop-off is also located. The overall composition creates a dialogue between architecture and nature, with the towers standing as vertical sentinels rooted in a landscape of privacy, greenery, and light.
